diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.description: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that affects a wide range of plants, causing white, powdery spots on leaves and stems.

diseases.name: Early Blight
diseases.description: Early blight, caused by the fungus Alternaria solani, leads to dark, sunken lesions on the leaves, stems, and fruit of tomato plants.
treatments: Remove and destroy infected plant parts

diseases.name: Leaf Spot
diseases.description: Leaf spot diseases, caused by different fungal and bacterial pathogens, lead to small, round lesions on plant leaves.
symptoms: Small, round spots with a yellow halo
preventiveTips: Space plants to improve air circulation

diseases.name: Powdery Scab
diseases.description: Powdery scab, caused by the fungus Spongospora subterranea, affects potato crops and forms scabs on tubers and root systems.
treatments: Fungicides may help in some cases
preventiveTips: Avoid growing potatoes in the same field each year

diseases.name: Rust
diseases.description: Rust is a fungal disease that typically affects the leaves and stems of various plants, causing orange, yellow, or red pustules on the surface.
commonSymptoms: Orange or yellow spots on leaves
symptoms: Orange or red pustules on leaves
preventiveTips: Remove fallen leaves and plant debris
Space plants properly to improve airflow

diseases.name: Tomato Blight
diseases.description: Tomato blight is a fungal disease caused by Phytophthora infestans that affects tomatoes, causing dark lesions and wilting.
symptoms: Wilting and yellowing of lower leaves
treatments: Remove and destroy infected plant material

diseases.name: Downy Mildew
diseases.description: Downy mildew is a fungal disease affecting plants like cucumbers and grapes, causing yellow or pale green leaf spots.
commonSymptoms: White fuzzy growth on the underside of leaves
symptoms: Yellow or white lesions on upper leaf surface
Downy growth on the underside of leaves

diseases.name: Cabbage Worms
diseases.description: Cabbage worms, including the larvae of cabbage butterflies, can damage cabbage, kale, and other brassicas, causing holes in leaves.
treatments: Use row covers to protect plants

diseases.name: Black Rot
diseases.description: Black rot, caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris, affects cruciferous plants like cabbage, causing blackening and decay.

diseases.name: Fusarium Wilt
diseases.description: Fusarium wilt is caused by the Fusarium fungus and affects various plants like tomatoes and peppers, causing wilting and yellowing of leaves.
